intro: Collinsonia urticifolia, commonly known as the stinging nettleleaf bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, stinging leaves that can cause irritation upon contact. The plant produces striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, wooded areas and is often found in shaded environments. Its unique botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological studies and horticultural interest.
